intro: Boehmeria travancarica, commonly known as Travancore hemp, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its slender, fibrous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is known for its strong, durable fibers, which have been traditionally used for making ropes and textiles. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
